meanings.definition: Able to be foretold or anticipated.
meanings.sent1: The movie's ending was so predictable that I guessed it halfway through.
meanings.sent2: The weather in this region is very predictable, with sunny days almost every day.
meanings.sent3: His predictable excuse for being late was blaming it on traffic again.
meanings.sent4: Her behavior was as predictable as the sunrise, always following the same routine.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's reaction was predictable, scolding the student for not completing the homework.

meanings.sent1: The predictable schedule of the train made it easy for commuters to plan their day.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant's menu had predictable options like burgers and fries.
meanings.sent3: His predictable habit of always wearing a blue shirt on Fridays became a running joke among his colleagues.
meanings.sent4: The predictable flow of the river mirrored the steady rhythm of life in the small town.
meanings.sent5: The predictable melody of the song made it easy for everyone to sing along.
